results:
Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about the original 1830 edition of Stendhal's "Le Rouge et le Noir" published by Levavasseur in Paris.

Here are the key details about the original 1830 edition:

## Publication Details
Le Rouge et le Noir was first published in its entirety in 1830 by Levavasseur. More specifically, Le Rouge et le Noir was published by Levavasseur on November 30, 1830 under Stendhal's pen name.

## Physical Description
This edition in two volumes was adorned with two title vignettes by Henry Monnier, engraved on wood by Porret. The search results confirm that the upper wrapper and titles featured vignettes by Henry Monnier, engraved by Porret.

## Illustrations
The original edition included two specific vignettes:
- Volume one vignette shows Julien Sorel appearing to Madame de Renal near a confessional; volume two shows Mathilde de La Mole holding the head of Julien Sorel

## Rarity and Significance
The first edition is "very rare and extremely sought-after", and was published as one of 750 copies, with title vignettes by Henry Monnier.

## Full Title
The novel's full title was "Le Rouge et le Noir: Chronique du XIXe siècle" (The Red and the Black: A Chronicle of the 19th Century).

The Levavasseur edition represents the true first edition of this masterpiece of French literature, making it highly valuable to collectors and scholars of 19th-century French literature.
